attributes.additional_details: Up to 400,000 farmed puppies are sold annually in the UK. Pet theft including by criminal gangs has risen by an estimated 250%. The RSPCA investigates more than 185,957 incidents per year. Up to 40,000 dogs are at risk of abandonment. 98% of vets are asked to euthanise healthy pets. The EU’s most profitable illegally traded commodities are drugs, arms and puppies. Cats Protection estimates there are 9 million stray and 1.5 million feral UK cats.
attributes.background: #PAWSLAW will introduce an Independent Animal Inspectorate, a National Pet Register (including DNA), stringent animal abuse and pet theft penalties and deterrents, a National Abusers Register, improved pet breeder licensing, a Minister for Animals and much more. www.handsoffcampaign.com/paws.html

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the welfare of pets, but petitions need to clearly set out the actions they want the Government to take. We cannot accept petitions that call for some actions and say that in order for their request to met "much more" would also need to be done, as it is not clear what the Government would need to do to meet the petition's request.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Introduce a National Pet Exchange Register: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/328081

Increase minimum and maximum sentences for pet theft: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563711

Make it illegal to sell dogs without a licence: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/571526

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
